info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 07 at 10:14PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...PATCHY FREEZING FOG AND DENSE FOG POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT... Fog is expected to continue expanding across the Piedmont and portions of the foothills tonight. The fog may become locally dense later tonight, reducing visibility to 1/4 mile or less. Temperatures are also expected to cool to the upper 20s and lower 30s, primarily in areas roughly along and north of I-85. In areas where fog is dense, water droplets may freeze on elevated surfaces. A few slick spots could therefore develop on bridges and overpasses by the time of the morning commute. Patchy dense fog, reducing visibility to 1/4 mile or less, will also create adverse driving conditions through the overnight. The fog is expected to gradually dissipate from the northwest overnight, and most areas should see the fog dissipate by shortly after sunrise. Motorists traveling across the Piedmont and foothills tonight into Tuesday morning should slow down, use low beam headlights and allow for plenty of distance between yourself and other vehicles.
